sense.gloss: disliking a certain food without having tried it
disliking something without having tried it, being prejudiced against, having an instinctive aversion to

sdata.j: チキンは↑食↑↓た↓べられない、というけど、↑単↑↓たん↓なる|↑食↑↓く↓わず↑嫌↑↓ぎら↓い|じゃないの。
sdata.e: You can't eat chicken? How do you know if you never try it?

sdata.j: トムはキウイを|↑食↑↓く↓わず↑嫌↑↓ぎら↓い|している。
sdata.e: Even though Tom has never even tried eating one, he says he doesn't like kiwifruit.

sdata.j: |↑食↑↓く↓わず↑嫌↑↓ぎら↓い|で↑寿司↑↓すし↓を↑敬遠↑↓けいえん↓する↑人↑↓ひと↓もいますが、↑何↑↓なん↓↑度↑↓ど↓か↑食↑↓た↓べるうちに「↑寿司↑↓すし↓の↑虜↑↓とりこ↓になった」という↑人↑↓ひと↓も↑結構↑↓けっこう↓↑多↑↓おお↓いですよ。
sdata.e: There are those who distance themselves from sushi without having ever tried it, but there are also a fair number of people who have "Become captive to sushi" having only tried it a few times.
